channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4

item.title: CVE-2022-4145|2024-08-03T01:27:54.542Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A content spoofing flaw was found in OpenShift's OAuth endpoint. This flaw allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to inject text into a webpage, enabling the obfuscation of a phishing operation.

item.title: CVE-2024-1342|2024-07-05T17:21:55.183Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenShift. The existing Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protections in place do not properly protect GET requests, allowing for the creation of WebSockets via CSRF.

item.title: CVE-2024-4369|2024-05-29T20:39:40.421Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: An information disclosure flaw was found in OpenShift's internal image registry operator. The AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET can be exposed through an environment variable defined in the pod definition, but is limited to Azure environments. An attacker controlling an account that has high enough permissions to obtain pod information from the openshift-image-registry namespace could use this obtained client secret to perform actions as the registry operator's Azure service account.

item.title: CVE-2024-1342|2024-06-04T19:34:06.352Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenShift. The existing Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protections in place do not properly protect GET requests, allowing for the creation of WebSockets via CSRF.

item.title: CVE-2024-1342|2024-08-01T18:33:25.609Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20openshift%20container%20platform%204
item.description: A flaw was found in OpenShift. The existing Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protections in place do not properly protect GET requests, allowing for the creation of WebSockets via CSRF.
